title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to impIndicator
text: outlines propose change impIndicator. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to impIndicator
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to impIndicator
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to impIndicator
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("b-cubed-eu/impIndicator", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to impIndicator
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to impIndicator
text: Please note impIndicator project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Background
text: … provide methodology computing three main product impIndicator.

title: Background
text: impact risk map shows impact score site, multiple species can present. compute impact risk per site, aggregated scores across species site needed. site_impact() uses max, sum mean metrics aggregate impact scores across species proposed Boulesnane-Guengant et al., (preparation). combinations within species aggregation metrics species across species site leads five methods calculating impact indicator, namely, precautionary, precautionary cumulative, mean, mean cumulative cumulative. precautionary: maximum score across species’ max site precautionary cumulative: cumulative score across species’ max site mean: mean score across species’ mean site mean cumulative: cumulative score across species’ mean site cumulative: cumulative score across species’ sum maximum score per mechanism

title: Background
text: compute impact indicator alien taxa, sum yearly impact scores site study region. correct sampling effort divide yearly impact scores number sites study region least single occurrence throughout whole year.Ii=∑SiNI_i = \frac{\sum{S_i}}{N} - IiI_i impact score year ii. - SiS_i sum risk map value, S={s1,s2,...,sn}S=\{s_1,s_2,...,s_n\} sns_n site score site nn - NN number sites occupied study years region.

title: Background
text: compute impact indicator per species summing impact risk map per species correct sampling effort dividing NN.

what: Process GBIF data from the R environment
title: Prepare data
text: import GBIF data using read.csv(), readr::read_csv(), readxl::read_excel() based data set format. example GBIF occurrences data minimum required columns.decimalLatitude, decimalLongitude, species, speciesKey, coordinateUncertaintyInMeters year region study given shapefile study area character representing country study area . example : cube sim_cube object. example acacia taxa South Africa
code: southAfrica_sf #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 0 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 16.48333 ymin: -34.822 xmax: 32.89043 ymax: -22.13639 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>                         geometry #> 1 MULTIPOLYGON (((31.2975 -22... acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   first_year = 2010,   last_year = 2023 ) # view processed cube acacia_cube #>  #> Simulated data cube for calculating biodiversity indicators #>  #> Date Range: 2010 - 2023  #> Number of cells: 369  #> Grid reference system: custom  #> Coordinate range: #> [1] 16.60833 #>  #> Total number of observations: 5272  #> Number of species represented: 28  #> Number of families represented: Data not present  #>  #> Kingdoms represented: Data not present  #>  #> First 10 rows of data (use n = to show more): #>  #> # A tibble: 5,272 × 8 #>    scientificName   taxonKey minCoordinateUncerta…¹  year cellCode xcoord ycoord #>    <chr>               <dbl>                  <dbl> <dbl> <chr>     <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                      8  2010 1376       30.4  -29.7 #>  2 Acacia saligna    2978552                      1  2010 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  3 Acacia implexa    2979232                      1  2010 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  4 Acacia pycnantha  2978604                      1  2010 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  5 Acacia cyclops    2980425                    122  2010 668        18.4  -32.2 #>  6 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                      1  2010 215        20.6  -33.9 #>  7 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                    110  2010 215        20.6  -33.9 #>  8 Acacia saligna    2978552                      1  2011 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  9 Acacia saligna    2978552                      1  2011 144        19.4  -34.2 #> 10 Acacia melanoxy…  2979000                      1  2011 206        18.4  -33.9 #> # ℹ 5,262 more rows #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​minCoordinateUncertaintyInMeters #> # ℹ 1 more variable: obs <dbl>

title: Prepare data
text: cube can generated downloading GBIF rgbif::occ_data()

title: Prepare data
text: impIndicator works cubes standard grid cell, , eea eqdgc processed b3gbi::process_cube(). example mammal_cube b3gbi package.
code: # Load GBIF data cube cube_name <- system.file("extdata", "denmark_mammals_cube_eqdgc.csv", package = "b3gbi")  # Prepare cube mammal_cube <- process_cube(cube_name,first_year = 2000)  # View cube  mammal_cube #>  #> Processed data cube for calculating biodiversity indicators #>  #> Date Range: 2000 - 2024  #> Single-resolution cube with cell size 0.25degrees ^2 #> Number of cells: 265  #> Grid reference system: eqdgc  #> Coordinate range: #>   xmin   xmax   ymin   ymax  #>  3.375 15.125 54.375 58.125  #>  #> Total number of observations: 191676  #> Number of species represented: 97  #> Number of families represented: 31  #>  #> Kingdoms represented: Animalia  #>  #> First 10 rows of data (use n = to show more): #>  #> # A tibble: 28,155 × 15 #>     year cellCode  kingdomKey kingdom  familyKey family  taxonKey scientificName #>    <dbl> <chr>          <dbl> <chr>        <dbl> <chr>      <dbl> <chr>          #>  1  2000 E006N56DB          1 Animalia      9680 Odoben…  5218819 Odobenus rosm… #>  2  2000 E008N54BA          1 Animalia      5310 Phocid…  2434793 Phoca vitulina #>  3  2000 E008N55AA          1 Animalia      5310 Phocid…  2434793 Phoca vitulina #>  4  2000 E008N55AB          1 Animalia      5307 Mustel…  2433753 Lutra lutra    #>  5  2000 E008N55AB          1 Animalia      5510 Muridae  7429082 Mus musculus   #>  6  2000 E008N55AC          1 Animalia      5307 Mustel…  2433753 Lutra lutra    #>  7  2000 E008N55AC          1 Animalia      5310 Phocid…  2434793 Phoca vitulina #>  8  2000 E008N55AC          1 Animalia      5310 Phocid…  2434806 Halichoerus g… #>  9  2000 E008N55AC          1 Animalia      9701 Canidae  5219243 Vulpes vulpes  #> 10  2000 E008N55AC          1 Animalia      9379 Lepori…  7952072 Lepus europae… #> # ℹ 28,145 more rows #> # ℹ 7 more variables: obs <dbl>, minCoordinateUncertaintyInMeters <dbl>, #> #   minTemporalUncertainty <dbl>, familyCount <dbl>, xcoord <dbl>, #> #   ycoord <dbl>, resolution <chr>

code: @Manual{,   title = {impIndicator: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa},   author = {Mukhtar Muhammed Yahaya and Sabrina Kumschick and Sandra MacFadyen and Pietro Landi and Cang Hui},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://b-cubed-eu.github.io/impIndicator/}, }

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: goal impIndicator allow users seamlessly calculate visualise impact alien taxa individual species given area. calculates visualises impact per site map. takes GBIF occurrence data EICAT assessment data. enables users choose various methods calculating impact indicators based different studies. impIndicator produces three main products can useful stated : -impact indicator <impact_indicator()> impact indicator offers nuanced representation trends biological invasions area (local, regional, global scales). tracking increase decrease ecological threats time, product provides insights dynamics invasive alien species impacts, helping assess whether current management practices effective need adjustment. temporal analysis impact indicator enables targeted resource allocation, fostering proactive interventions mitigate biodiversity loss ecosystem degradation. -site impact <site_impact() site impact map serves visual analytical tool represent intensity biological invasions across different parts area. enabling spatial comparisons—provinces, states, conservation areas—highlights hotspots areas risk invasion impact. spatial data useful prioritising management actions, coordinating restoration projects, fostering cross-regional collaboration address invasive species impacts effectively. -species impact <species_impact() species impact produces trends individual invasive alien species, enabling species-specific impact caused invasions. data supports comparisons individual species’ impacts, revealing roles interactions within invaded area. species impact invaluable prioritising species-specific management efforts, informing eradication strategies, advancing research alien species’ ecological roles adaptation patterns.

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: can install development version impIndicator GitHub :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("b-cubed-eu/impIndicator")

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: Markdown demonstrates computation visualisation impact indicator biological invasions using impact_indicator() compute impact indicator alien taxa, species_impact() compute impact indicator per species, site_impact() compute impact indicator per site. functions feeds species GBIF occurrence cube b3gbi::process_cube() using taxa_cube() Environmental Impact Classification Alien Taxa (EICAT) impact score species. Read background products https://b-cubed-eu.github.io/impIndicator/articles/Background.html
code: # Load packages library(impIndicator)  library(b3gbi) # Biodiversity indicators for data cubes library(tidyverse) # Data wrangling and visualisation library(sf) # Spatial features

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF) occurrence data standardised species information documents presence absence species particular locations times.
code: # Process cube from GBIF occurrence data in the R studio environment  acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   first_year = 2010 )  acacia_cube #>  #> Simulated data cube for calculating biodiversity indicators #>  #> Date Range: 2010 - 2024  #> Number of cells: 402  #> Grid reference system: custom  #> Coordinate range: #> [1] 16.60833 #>  #> Total number of observations: 6508  #> Number of species represented: 29  #> Number of families represented: Data not present  #>  #> Kingdoms represented: Data not present  #>  #> First 10 rows of data (use n = to show more): #>  #> # A tibble: 6,508 × 8 #>    scientificName   taxonKey minCoordinateUncerta…¹  year cellCode xcoord ycoord #>    <chr>               <dbl>                  <dbl> <dbl> <chr>     <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                      8  2010 1376       30.4  -29.7 #>  2 Acacia saligna    2978552                      1  2010 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  3 Acacia implexa    2979232                      1  2010 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  4 Acacia pycnantha  2978604                      1  2010 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  5 Acacia cyclops    2980425                    122  2010 668        18.4  -32.2 #>  6 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                      1  2010 215        20.6  -33.9 #>  7 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                    110  2010 215        20.6  -33.9 #>  8 Acacia saligna    2978552                      1  2011 206        18.4  -33.9 #>  9 Acacia saligna    2978552                      1  2011 144        19.4  -34.2 #> 10 Acacia melanoxy…  2979000                      1  2011 206        18.4  -33.9 #> # ℹ 6,498 more rows #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​minCoordinateUncertaintyInMeters #> # ℹ 1 more variable: obs <dbl>

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: Environmental Impact Classification Alien Taxa (EICAT) assessment data reported impact alien taxa based EICAT method International Union Conservation Nature (IUCN) standard. assessed alien taxa adequate data classified massive (MV), major (MR), moderate (MO), minor (MN), minimal concern (MC) depending severity impact caused recipient ecosystem. Additional information mechanisms location impact also recorded. example EICAT data :
code: # view EICAT data head(eicat_acacia,10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    scientific_name   impact_category impact_mechanism                            #>    <chr>             <chr>           <chr>                                       #>  1 Acacia saligna    MC              (1) Competition                             #>  2 Acacia saligna    MC              (12) Indirect impacts through interaction … #>  3 Acacia saligna    MC              (1) Competition                             #>  4 Acacia saligna    MC              (1) Competition; (9) Chemical impact on th… #>  5 Acacia mearnsii   MC              (6) Poisoning/toxicity                      #>  6 Acacia longifolia MC              (9) Chemical impact on ecosystems           #>  7 Acacia dealbata   MC              (9) Chemical impact on ecosystems           #>  8 Acacia dealbata   MC              (9) Chemical impact on ecosystems           #>  9 Acacia saligna    MC              (9) Chemical impact on ecosystems           #> 10 Acacia dealbata   MC              (12) Indirect impacts through interaction …

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: impact risk map shows impact score site, multiple species can present. compute impact risk per site, aggregated scores across species site needed. site_impact() uses max, sum mean metrics aggregate impact scores across species proposed Boulesnane-Guengant et al., (preparation). combinations within species aggregation metrics species across species site leads five methods calculating impact indicator, namely, precautionary, precautionary cumulative, mean, mean cumulative cumulative.
code: siteImpact <- site_impact(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "mean cumulative" )  # impact map # visualize last four years for readability plot(x = siteImpact, region = southAfrica_sf, first_year = 2021)

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: compute impact indicator alien taxa, sum yearly impact scores site study region. correct sampling effort divide yearly impact scores number sites study region least single occurrence throughout whole year.
code: # impact indicator  impactIndicator <- impact_indicator(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "mean cumulative" ) # visualise impact indicator plot(impactIndicator)

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: compute impact indicator per species summing impact risk map per species correct sampling effort dividing NN.
code: #  impact indicator per species  species_value <- species_impact(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "mean" )  # visualise species impact plot(species_value) #> Warning: Removed 9 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_line()`).

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: compare methods used calculating impact indicators case study, provide plot can adapted user compare set method.
code: # plot all method of impact indicators methods <- c(   "precautionary",   "precautionary cumulative",   "mean",   "mean cumulative",   "cumulative" )  all_impact <- data.frame("year" = unique(acacia_cube$data$year)) for (method in methods) {   impact_value <- impact_indicator(     cube = acacia_cube,     impact_data = eicat_acacia,     method = method,     trans = 1   )    all_impact[method] <- impact_value$diversity_val }  #plot the trend all_impact %>%   gather(-year, key = "indicator_method", value = "impact_score") %>%   ggplot(aes(x = year, y = impact_score)) +   geom_line(aes(color = indicator_method), linewidth = 1.5) +   theme_minimal() +   labs(     title = "Indicator of different menthods",     y = "impact score"   ) +   theme(text = element_text(size = 14))

title: Compute impact categories — impact_cat
text: Aggregate species impact categories impact data.

title: Compute impact categories — impact_cat
code: impact_cat(   impact_data,   species_list,   trans = 1,   col_category = NULL,   col_species = NULL,   col_mechanism = NULL )

title: Compute impact categories — impact_cat
text: impact_data dataframe species impact contains columns impact_category, scientific_name impact_mechanism. species_list vector species' list aggregate impact categories trans Numeric. type transformation convert EICAT categories numerical values. 1 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (0,1,2,3,4) 2 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,2,3,4,5) 3 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,10,100,1000,10000) col_category name column containing impact categories. first two letters categories must EICAT short names (e.g "MC -Minimal concern") col_species name column containing species names col_mechanism name column containing mechanisms impact

title: Compute impact categories — impact_cat
text: dataframe containing aggregated species impact. max - maximum impact species. mean - mean impact species. max_mech - sum maximum impact per categories species

title: Compute impact categories — impact_cat
code: # define species list species_list <- c(   "Acacia adunca",   "Acacia baileyana",   "Acacia binervata",   "Acacia crassiuscula",   "Acacia cultriformis",   "Acacia cyclops",   "Acacia dealbata",   "Acacia decurrens",   "Acacia elata" )  agg_impact <- impact_cat(   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   species_list = species_list,   trans = 1 )

title: Impact indicator — impact_indicator
text: Compute impact indicators alien taxa

title: Impact indicator — impact_indicator
code: impact_indicator(   cube,   impact_data = NULL,   method = NULL,   trans = 1,   col_category = NULL,   col_species = NULL,   col_mechanism = NULL )

title: Impact indicator — impact_indicator
text: cube data cube class sim_cube processed_cube b3gbi::process_cube() impact_data dataframe species impact contains columns impact_category, scientific_name impact_mechanism method method computing indicator. method used aggregation within across species site. method can precautionary, precautionary cumulative, mean, mean cumulative cumulative. trans Numeric. method transformation convert EICAT categories numerical values. 1 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (0,1,2,3,4) 2 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,2,3,4,5) 3 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,10,100,1000,10000) col_category name column containing impact categories. first two letters categories must EICAT short names (e.g "MC - Minimal concern") col_species name column containing species names col_mechanism name column containing mechanisms impact

title: Impact indicator — impact_indicator
text: dataframe invasive alien impact trend (class impact_indicator)

title: Impact indicator — impact_indicator
code: acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010 ) impact_value <- impact_indicator(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "mean cumulative",   trans = 1 )

Default "Impact indicator" y_lab Label y-axis. Default "impact score" text_size size text plot. Default "14" ... Additional arguments passed geom_line

text: ggplot object impact indicator, y- x-axes representing impact score time respectively.

code: # create data_cube acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010 )  # compute impact indicator impact_value <- impact_indicator(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "mean cumulative",   trans = 1 ) # plot impact indicator plot(impact_value)

title: Plot site impact — plot.site_impact

title: Plot site impact — plot.site_impact
text: x dataframe impact indicator. Must class "site_impact" region sf character. shapefile region study character represent name country. compulsory makes plot comprehensible. first_year first year impact map include. Default starts first year included x. last_year last year impact map include. Default ends last year included x. title_lab Title plot. Default "Impact map" text_size size text plot. Default "14" ... Additional arguments passed geom_tile

title: Plot site impact — plot.site_impact
text: ggplot species yearly impact region.

title: Plot site impact — plot.site_impact
code: # define cube for taxa acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010 )  # compute site impact siteImpact <- site_impact(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "precautionary cumulative",   trans = 1  )  # visualise site impact plot(x=siteImpact, region= southAfrica_sf, first_year = 2021)

title: Plot species impact — plot.species_impact
text: Produces ggplot show trend species impact.

title: Plot species impact — plot.species_impact
code: # S3 method for class 'species_impact' plot(   x,   alien_species = "all",   linewidth = 1.5,   title_lab = "Species impact",   y_lab = "impact score",   text_size = 14,   ... )

title: Plot species impact — plot.species_impact
text: x dataframe impact indicator. Must class "species_impact" alien_species character vector containing names alien species included plot. Default "" plot species data frame linewidth width size line. Default 1.5 title_lab Title plot. Default "Species impact" y_lab Label y-axis. Default "impact score" text_size size text plot. Default "14" ... Additional arguments passed geom_line

title: Plot species impact — plot.species_impact
text: ggplot object species impact, y- x-axes representing impact score time respectively.

title: Plot species impact — plot.species_impact
code: # create data cube acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010 )  # compute species impact speciesImpact <- species_impact(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "mean",   trans = 1 )  # visualise species impact plot(speciesImpact) #> Warning: Removed 9 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_line()`).

title: Compute site impact indicator — site_impact
text: Compute site impact indicator

title: Compute site impact indicator — site_impact
code: site_impact(   cube,   impact_data = NULL,   method = NULL,   trans = 1,   col_category = NULL,   col_species = NULL,   col_mechanism = NULL )

title: Compute site impact indicator — site_impact
text: cube data cube class sim_cube processed_cube b3gbi::process_cube() impact_data dataframe species impact contains columns impact_category, scientific_name impact_mechanism method method computing indicator. method used aggregation within across species site. method can precautionary, precautionary cumulative, mean, mean cumulative cumulative. trans Numeric. method transformation convert EICAT categories numerical values. 1 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (0,1,2,3,4) 2 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,2,3,4,5) 3 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,10,100,1000,10000) col_category name column containing impact categories. first two letters categories must EICAT short names (e.g "MC - Minimal concern") col_species name column containing species names col_mechanism name column containing mechanisms impact

title: Compute site impact indicator — site_impact
text: dataframe impact indicator per sites (class site_impact)

title: Compute site impact indicator — site_impact
code: # define cube for taxa acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010 )  siteImpact <- site_impact(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "precautionary cumulative",   trans = 1 )

title: Compute species impact indicator — species_impact
text: cube data cube class sim_cube processed_cube b3gbi::process_cube() impact_data dataframe species impact contains columns impact_category, scientific_name impact_mechanism method method computing indicator. method used aggregation within impact species. method can "max", "mean" "max_mech". trans Numeric. method transformation convert EICAT categories numerical values. 1 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (0,1,2,3,4) 2 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,2,3,4,5) 3 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,10,100,1000,10000) col_category name column containing impact categories. first two letters categories must EICAT short names (e.g "MC - Minimal concern") col_species name column containing species names col_mechanism name column containing mechanisms impact

title: Compute species impact indicator — species_impact
text: dataframe impact indicator per species (class species_impact)

title: Compute species impact indicator — species_impact
code: acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010 )  speciesImpact <- species_impact(   cube = acacia_cube,   impact_data = eicat_acacia,   method = "mean",   trans = 1 )

title: Prepare Data Cubes — taxa_cube
text: Prepare data cube calculate species impact . function taxa_cube can take scientific name taxa interest character GBIF occurrences data containing necessary columns. GBIF occurrences downloaded scientific names given.

title: Prepare Data Cubes — taxa_cube
code: taxa_cube(   taxa,   region,   limit = 500,   country = NULL,   res = 0.25,   first_year = NULL,   last_year = NULL )

title: Prepare Data Cubes — taxa_cube
text: taxa Character dataframe. character scientific name focal taxa dataframe GBIF occurrences data must contain "decimalLatitude","decimalLongitude","species","speciesKey", "coordinateUncertaintyInMeters","dateIdentified", "year". region sf character. shapefile region study character represent name country limit Number records return GBIF download. Default set 500 country Two-letter country code (ISO-3166-1) Country GBIP occurrences data downloaded. res resolution grid cells used. Default 0.25 first_year year occurrence start last_year year occurrence end

title: Prepare Data Cubes — taxa_cube
text: data cube sim_cubes

title: Prepare Data Cubes — taxa_cube
code: acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   first_year = 2010 )
